value: aava_1.0_score
description

The two metadata versions represent largely the same conceptual workflow model with moderate schema evolution and structural reorganization. Both versions define a DI AbInitio to PySpark conversion workflow with 5 agents but with significant naming and structural changes.
Core workflow concept preserved: Both versions define a data integration workflow for converting AbInitio to PySpark with the same fundamental purpose and agent responsibilities.
Agent semantic alignment: All 5 agents maintain their core functional purpose - converter, unit tester, conversion tester, recon tester, and reviewer - with preserved business meaning.
Major structural reorganization: AAVA 2.0 introduces nested workFlowDetail object replacing flat workflowId/workflowName structure, increasing hierarchy depth.
Agent array restructuring: AAVA 1.0 uses 'nodes' array while AAVA 2.0 uses 'workflowAgents' array with different internal structure.
Workflow ID field: workflowId (2727) in v1 vs id (1896) in workFlowDetail in v2. Values differ significantly.
Workflow name evolution: workflowName 'DI_AbInitio_To_PySpark_Conversion' vs name 'DI AbInitio To PySpark Conversion' with spacing differences.
Agent naming convention: 'agentName' in v1 becomes 'name' in v2, losing the explicit 'agent' prefix.
Model specification evolution: 'model' field in v1 becomes 'modelDeploymentName' in v2 with different values (anthropic.claude-4-sonnet vs gpt-4.1).
Agent ID introduction: AAVA 2.0 introduces agentId field (3624, 3643, 3645, 3655, 3672) not present in v1.
Tools array transformation: v1 'tools' array with string values becomes v2 'toolReferences' empty array, indicating architectural change.
Task object flattening: v1 nested task.description becomes v2 flat description field, reducing nesting depth.
Missing task structure: AAVA 2.0 removes the task object wrapper and expectedOutput field present in v1.
Metadata completeness degradation: v2 removes expectedOutput descriptions that provided important context about agent deliverables.
Tool reference type change: String array 'tools' in v1 vs empty array 'toolReferences' in v2 suggests different tool management approach.
Inconsistent field naming: workFlowDetail uses camelCase 'workFlowDetail' but contains 'name' field, mixing conventions.
Agent structure evolution: Significant restructuring from task-oriented to deployment-oriented agent definitions.
Breaking change impact: Field name changes and structural reorganization will require updates to dependent systems and APIs.
Data migration complexity: Different ID values and structural changes require careful mapping during version migration.
Tool reference ambiguity: Empty toolReferences arrays in v2 unclear whether tools are deprecated or moved elsewhere.
JSON syntax validation: Both versions are syntactically valid JSON with proper structure and no parsing errors.
Content preservation: All agent descriptions maintain identical detailed task specifications ensuring functional continuity.
Workflow integrity: Despite structural changes, the logical workflow sequence and agent relationships are preserved.
